comment.author: 91549360@N03
comment._content: '' The schools ambition never matched its budget, and by 1779 as the main block neared completion, it was designed not to proceed with a large quadrangle to the rear. Ivory resigned from the project in disgust. His graceful tower was never completed beyound a stub which was eventually removed in 1894 and the dome we see today constructed to cap the base.'' So 115 years? archiseek.com/2012/1773-blue-coat-school-blackhall-place-...

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: That must be the most entries we've ever seen in the DIA? DIA says 1894 for "Erection of cupola (not to Ivory's desing) to complete tower designed by Ivory" and 1901-1904 for completion of cupola. If you look closely, there are girders showing in the gaps. Pilasters being added too? Which phase are we in? 1901-1904 for completion of erection of cupola??
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: The telephone lines might provide an earliest date - any old phone books at Library Ivory Towers?

comment.author: 91549360@N03
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/nlireland]  The photograph was taken before any work was started on the ''new'' cupola as the cupola now sits where those pillars with your "girders" once stood. [http://www.flickr.com/photos/91549360@N03/11098988884/] So pre 1894.
I know dating from plate numbers can be unreliable but there's a W.L two #'s up (L_ROY_03084) of Cardinal McCabe's memorial in Glasnevin which was erected in 1888..

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/91549360@N03] Right so, thanks! Then back to 1894 as the latest possible date for this photo, when the "stub" was removed. And if we take your punt on Cardinal McCabe's Memorial, earliest could be 1888...
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons
